FacilityStr1: 1M S HWY 8 & 75 E SIDE OF ROAD
OperatorStr1: 1M S HWY 8 & 75 E SIDE OF ROAD

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT YOUR FACILITY.

RESPONSE:  STATE LINE AG COMPLIES WITH ANSI K-61 REQUIREMENTS FOR A/A STORAGE
                     AND IT IS OUR POLICY TO ADHERE TO ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL       
                      LAWS.  WE ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE
                      OF A/A.  IF AN EMERGENCY WERE TO OCCUR, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY DAWSON
                      FIRE DEPARTMENT, AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.

A DESCRIPTION OF YOUR FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED.

RESPONSE:  THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS FACILITY IS STORAGE OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE
                     TO THE AGRICULTURAL SECTOR.  A/A IS RECEIVED, STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR
                     DIRECT APPLICATION TO FARMERS.  ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO
                     AUTHORIZED FACILITY EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL AND
                     AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS.

THE WORSE-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO.

RESPONSE:  WE USED RMP COMP TO DETERMINE THE WORST-CASE SCENARIO RELEASE AT OUR     
                     FACILITY.

THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND THE SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS.

RESPONSE:  THE FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH
                     ALL APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED
                     THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING
                      OF A/A, K-61.1". PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE
                     INC., AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH
                     ADMINISTRATION (osha), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF A/A".

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.

RESPONSE:  WE NEVER HAD AN ACCIDENT INVOLVING A/A THAT CAUSED DEATH, INJURIES
                     PROPERTY OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE, EVACUATIONS OR SHELTERINGS IN PLACE.

THE EME

RGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

RESPONSE:  THE FACILITY HAS PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY 
                     PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION  AS REQUIRED UNDER
                     SARA TITLE I I I (EPCRA) 

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.
 
RESPONSE:  SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC
                     EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE
                     CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC A/A SAFETY
                     RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
             
                     THIS IS A NAME CHANGE FROM WITTWER FERTILIZER TO STATE LINE AG
                     ALSO OPERATOR NAME CHANGE TO NEAL KANEL
